009
010package imagingbook.common.regions;
011
012import java.util.Deque;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
018
019/**
020 * <p> 
021 * Binary region segmentation based on a breadth-first flood filling algorithm
022 * using a queue. See Sec. 8.1.1 (Alg. 8.2) of [1] for additional details.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
026 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
027 * </p>
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2020/04/01
031 * @version 2022/09/28 revised
032 */
033public class BreadthFirstSegmentation extends BinaryRegionSegmentation {
034        
035        /**
036         * Constructor. Creates a new region segmentation from the specified image,
037         * which is not modified. The input image is considered binary, with 0 values
038         * for background pixels and values &ne; 0 for foreground pixels. The
039         * 4-neighborhood is used by default
040         * ({@link BinaryRegionSegmentation#DefaultNeighborhoodT}).
041         * 
042         * @param ip the binary input image to be segmented
043         */
044        public BreadthFirstSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
045                this(ip, DefaultNeighborhoodT);
046        }
047        
048        /**
049         * Constructor. Creates a new region segmentation from the specified image and
050         * neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood). The input image is considered
051         * binary, with 0 values for background pixels and values &ne; 0 for foreground
052         * pixels.
053         * 
054         * @param ip the binary input image to be segmented
055         * @param nh the neighborhood type (4- or 8-neighborhood)
056         */
057        public BreadthFirstSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType2D nh) {
058                super(ip, nh);
059        }
060        
061        @Override
062        boolean applySegmentation(ByteProcessor ip) {
063                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
064                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
065                                if (getLabel(u, v) == Foreground) {
066                                        // start a new region
067                                        int label = getNextLabel();
068                                        //IJ.log(String.format("assigning label %d at (%d,%d), maxLabel=%d", label, u, v, maxLabel));
069                                        floodFill(u, v, label);
070                                }
071                        }
072                }
073                return true;
074        }
075
076        private void floodFill(int u, int v, int label) {
077                Deque<PntInt> Q = new LinkedList<>();   //queue contains pixel coordinates
078                Q.addLast(PntInt.from(u, v));
079                while (!Q.isEmpty()) {
080                        PntInt p = Q.removeFirst();     // get the next point to process
081                        int x = p.x;
082                        int y = p.y;
083                        if ((x >= 0) && (x < width) && (y >= 0) && (y < height) && getLabel(x, y) == Foreground) {
084                                setLabel(x, y, label);
085                                Q.addLast(PntInt.from(x + 1, y));
086                                Q.addLast(PntInt.from(x, y + 1));
087                                Q.addLast(PntInt.from(x, y - 1));
088                                Q.addLast(PntInt.from(x - 1, y));
089                                if (NT == NeighborhoodType2D.N8) {
090                                        Q.addLast(PntInt.from(x + 1, y + 1));
091                                        Q.addLast(PntInt.from(x - 1, y + 1));
092                                        Q.addLast(PntInt.from(x + 1, y - 1));
093                                        Q.addLast(PntInt.from(x - 1, y - 1));
094                                }
095                        }
096                }
097        }
098
099}
